移.definition: to move; to shift; to change; to alter; to remove

移位.definition: to shift; shift; translocation; displacement; (medicine) dislocation

移借.definition: to put to a different use; to borrow; (linguistics) borrowing

移動.definition: to move; movement; migration; mobile; portable

移動平均線指標.pinyin: yi2 dong4 ping2 jun1 xian4 zhi3 biao1
移動平均線指標.definition: moving average index (used in financial analysis)

移動硬盤.definition: portable hard drive; external hard drive

移動通信網絡.pinyin: yi2 dong4 tong1 xin4 wang3 luo4

移居.definition: to migrate; to move to a new place of residence

移山倒海.definition: lit. to move mountains and drain seas; to transform nature

移山志.definition: the will to move mountains; fig. high ambitions

移工.definition: (Tw) foreign worker (abbr. for 移住勞工|移住劳工[yi2 zhu4 lao2 gong1])

移師.definition: to move troops to; (fig.) to move to; to shift to

移情.definition: to redirect one's affections; (of literature etc) to cultivate people's character; empathy (i.e. attribution of feelings to an object); transference (psychology)

移情別戀.definition: change of affection, shift of love (idiom); to change one's feelings to another love; to fall in love with sb else

移機.definition: to relocate a piece of equipment (air conditioner etc)

移民.definition: to immigrate; to migrate; emigrant; immigrant

移用.definition: to use (sth) for a purpose other than its original one; to adapt (tools, methods etc) for another purpose

移花接木.definition: lit. to graft flowers onto a tree (idiom); fig. to surreptitiously substitute one thing for another

移送.definition: to transfer (a case, a person, files etc)

移送法辦.definition: to bring to justice; to hand over to the law
